title: It's Set to Be the Summer of French Riviera Style, According to Celine
excerpt: Celine's summer collection taps into Saint-Tropez style.
text: We're already primed for a very stylish summer ahead, especially with the release of the Été Celine 2025 collection, which predicts a holiday wardrobe that taps into French Riviera style. For the summer collection, the fashion house was inspired by Saint-Tropez with designs that capture the allure of the South of France. Swimsuits are constructed in gingham-printed Vichy jersey and finished with Triomphe hardware embellishments. Bucket bags are crafted in woven raffia, while travel duffles and small pouches are adorned with nautical anchor prints and leather trim. Clothing is constructed from white and navy crochet, and dark-wash denim is embellished with gold buttons. Footwear takes on the form of leather boat shoes and thong sandals. The colorways revolve around white, navy, red, luggage brown, and azure—a palette that blends in seamlessly with the locale.In essence, the collection is the epitome of French Riviera fashion. It distills the style of fashion icons, ranging from Brigitte Bardot to Naomi Campbell to Kendall Jenner, who have visited the famed glittering shores. The Celine designs offer a summer 2025 wardrobe with pieces primed for a jet-setting summer itinerary—a baseball hat for early tennis lessons, a denim miniskirt for mornings at the local markets, a Triomphe bikini for days spent on lounge chairs at a beach club overlooking the Mediterranean, and crochet dresses for sunset strolls to dinner. Ahead, shop the Été Celine 2025 collection.Shop the Été Celine 2025 Collection celine Small Louise Bucket Bag CELINE Triomphe Balconette Top in Vichy Jersey CELINE Triomphe Swimsuit Bottom in Vichy Jersey CELINE Trapeze Mini Skirt CELINE Triomphe 01 Sunglasses CELINE Un Été Français Eau de Parfum CELINE Triomphe Mini Dress CELINE Lympia Triomphe Thong in Calfskin CELINE Triomphe Fouta in Striped Cotton CELINE Anchor Baseball Cap CELINE Small Pouch With Strap CELINE Triomphe 15 Sunglasses Kristen Nichols is the Associate Director, Special Projects at Who What Wear where she oversees luxury, runway content, and wedding features, and covers fashion within the luxury market, runway reporting, shopping features, trends, and interviews with leading industry experts. Kristen has worked with brands including Prada, Chanel, and Tiffany & Co., and her style has been featured in publications including Vogue.com, Vogue France, WWD, and the CFDA. Kristen began her career at Rodarte, where she worked on styling, photo shoots, and runway shows, and at Allure, where she moved into print and digital editorial. She graduated from the University of Southern California, where she studied art history and business, and currently lives in New York.
html:
We're already primed for a very stylish summer ahead, especially with the release of the Été Celine 2025 collection, which predicts a holiday wardrobe that taps into French Riviera style. For the summer collection, the fashion house was inspired by Saint-Tropez with designs that capture the allure of the South of France. Swimsuits are constructed in gingham-printed Vichy jersey and finished with Triomphe hardware embellishments. Bucket bags are crafted in woven raffia, while travel duffles and small pouches are adorned with nautical anchor prints and leather trim. Clothing is constructed from white and navy crochet, and dark-wash denim is embellished with gold buttons. Footwear takes on the form of leather boat shoes and thong sandals. The colorways revolve around white, navy, red, luggage brown, and azure—a palette that blends in seamlessly with the locale.

In essence, the collection is the epitome of French Riviera fashion. It distills the style of fashion icons, ranging from Brigitte Bardot to Naomi Campbell to Kendall Jenner, who have visited the famed glittering shores. The Celine designs offer a summer 2025 wardrobe with pieces primed for a jet-setting summer itinerary—a baseball hat for early tennis lessons, a denim miniskirt for mornings at the local markets, a Triomphe bikini for days spent on lounge chairs at a beach club overlooking the Mediterranean, and crochet dresses for sunset strolls to dinner. Ahead, shop the Été Celine 2025 collection.

Kristen Nichols is the Associate Director, Special Projects at Who What Wear where she oversees luxury, runway content, and wedding features, and covers fashion within the luxury market, runway reporting, shopping features, trends, and interviews with leading industry experts. Kristen has worked with brands including Prada, Chanel, and Tiffany & Co., and her style has been featured in publications including Vogue.com, Vogue France, WWD, and the CFDA. Kristen began her career at Rodarte, where she worked on styling, photo shoots, and runway shows, and at Allure, where she moved into print and digital editorial. She graduated from the University of Southern California, where she studied art history and business, and currently lives in New York.
